thread.title: Singapore Dollar Tad Weaker as Bets Trimmed Before MAS Meet
thread.title_full: Singapore Dollar Tad Weaker as Bets Trimmed Before MAS Meet - WSJ

author: Ewen Chew
title: Singapore Dollar Tad Weaker as Bets Trimmed Before MAS Meet
text: [Dow Jones] The Singapore dollar has slipped 0.4% versus the U.S. unit Monday, despite risk appetite remaining generally positive after last week’s surge in Asian currencies. Speculators may be taking profit on short-USD positions before the Monetary Authority of Singapore’s monetary policy decision on October 14, the same day third quarter gross domestic product data will be published. Analysts think there is a strong chance that the MAS might adjust lower the slope that governs the rate of appreciation of the Singapore dollar, effectively an easing of monetary policy.
